title: Sarah Ennis, PhD
text:
Hi there! 

I’m Sarah, a bioinformatician and data scientist with 5 years of experience.
I’m originally from Dublin, Ireland and currently based in Kingston, Ontario.
I have expertise in conducting a wide range of bioinformatics analyses and specialise in the analysis of single-cell transcriptomic data.
I also have a keen interest in data visualisation and enjoy developing R Shiny apps and R packages.
I’m currently open to job opportunities that are either hybrid in the Toronto area or remote, anywhere in Canada.
If you’re interested in hiring me, you can find my CV here and reach out to me via email at ennissarah94@gmail.com.

title: Sarah Ennis, PhD
text:
Education

PhD in Genomics Data Science | University of Galway | Galway, Ireland | Sept 2019 - Dec 2023

Recently completed my PhD which focused on using single-cell gene expression data to investigate novel drug targets in acute myleoid leukemia.

MSc in Biomedical Genomics | University of Galway | Galway, Ireland | Sept 2018 - July 2019

During my MSc I received robust training in all aspects of genomics data analysis and conducted a research project on characterising transcriptional heterogeneity between tissue-resident macrophage subsets using single-cell gene expression data.

BSc in Human Health & Disease | Trinity College Dublin | Dublin, Ireland | Sept 2013 - July 2017

title: Sarah Ennis, PhD
text:
Experience

Visiting Researcher | Max Delbrück Centre | Berlin, Germany | Oct 2022 - Dec 2022


Visiting Researcher | Wellcome Sanger Institute | Cambridge, UK | May 2019 - July 2019


R&D Scientist | airmid healthgroup ltd | Dublin, Ireland | May 2016 - Sept 2018
